meanings.definition: The state of being complete or whole.
meanings.sent1: The entirenesses of the puzzle were evident once all the pieces were put together.
meanings.sent2: She admired the entirenesses of the beautiful painting hanging on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The entirenesses of the cake disappeared quickly at the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: His speech captured the entirenesses of the audience's attention.
meanings.sent5: The entirenesses of the forest at dawn were breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The quality of being unbroken or undivided.
meanings.sent1: The entirenesses of the glass vase made it stand out among the other decorations.
meanings.sent2: The entirenesses of the mirror reflected her image perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The entirenesses of the silence in the library was disrupted by a loud sneeze.
meanings.sent4: The entirenesses of the team's spirit helped them win the championship.
meanings.sent5: The entirenesses of the melody filled the room with joy.
